question: 3 (c)
sols_html:
x=rand(1000,1); % Make x a random vector

x=x/norm(x); % Normalize x

for n=1:N

x=(A-2*eye(1000))\x; % The next iteration of x is (A-2I)/x

x=x/norm(x); % Normalize x

end

lambda=dot(x,A*x)
sols_latex:
x=rand(1000,1); \% Make x a random vector

x=x/norm(x); \% Normalize x

for n=1:N

x=(A-2*eye(1000))\textbackslash{}x; \% The next iteration of x is
(A-2I)/x

x=x/norm(x); \% Normalize x

end

lambda=dot(x,A*x)
sols_raw:
x=rand(1000,1);  % Make x a random vector

x=x/norm(x);      % Normalize x

for n=1:N

x=(A-2*eye(1000))\x;   % The next iteration of x is (A-2I)/x

x=x/norm(x);  % Normalize x

end

lambda=dot(x,A*x)
statement_html: Write down the MATLAB/OCTAVE commands that implement the procedure in part (b) with N iterations. Assume that A and N have been defined in MATLAB/OCTAVE, and that the size of A is 1000 x 1000.
statement_latex:
Write down the MATLAB/OCTAVE commands that implement the procedure in
{part
(b)} with \emph{N} iterations. Assume that \emph{A} and \emph{N} have
been defined in MATLAB/OCTAVE, and that the size of \emph{A} is
\emph{1000 x 1000}.
statement_raw: Write down the MATLAB/OCTAVE commands that implement the procedure in [[Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH307/April_2013/Question_03_(b)|part (b)]] with ''N'' iterations. Assume that ''A'' and ''N'' have been defined in MATLAB/OCTAVE, and that the size of ''A'' is ''1000 x 1000''.
